Title: Diri mourns demise of Olubolade
Summary: Governor of Bayelsa State, Douye Diri, has described as shocking the sudden demise of one of his predecessors, Navy Captain Caleb Olubolade (rtd).

Title: Energy firm appoints new MD
Summary: Sunbeth Energies Limited has announced the appointment of Lateef Abioye as its new Managing Director . The energy firm appoints Lateef as the Managing Director of the firm .

Title: Edo community rejects ‘shambolic’ selection of new king
Summary: Ukhomuyio community of Okpella in Edo State has rejected what it described as a shambolic process that led to the selection of Mike Sado as the new king .

Title: Codix Pharma launches test kits production facility
Summary: Codix Pharma has launched a new facility for the local production of rapid test kits . The facility is a major step toward improving healthcare access to timely and affordable diagnostics .

Title: Forest striker Awoniyi placed in induced coma after surger- reports
Summary: Nottingham Forest striker Taiwo Awoniyi has been placed in an induced coma to help his recovery from urgent abdominal surgery . The Nigeria international was rushed to hospital for the operation on Monday, having suffered a minor injury .

Title: CBN drives FX inflows through non-oil export strategy
Summary: The apex bank’s Governor, Yemi Cardoso, is currently placing huge support to non-oil export strategy . …as crude oil price dips, CBN has ramped up measures to attract more foreign exchange .

Title: UTME mass failure: Weeping not enough, resign now—Varsity don tells JAMB Registrar
Summary: Dr Christian Okeke, has called on the Registrar of the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (JAMB), Prof. Ishaq Oloyede, to resign now .

Title: Smart-City: Lagos investments partnership network hits over $13trn in 6yrs
Summary: Lagos State Government said it has attracted over $13 trillion worth partnership deals through strategic global alliances . The state government said it also secured over $4 million in Business Enabling Reforms, SABER, disbursements during the initial assessment .

Title: Lead ESG compliant financial disclosures’, Keystone Bank boss charges Accountants
Summary: Accountants must lead development of Environmental, Social and Governance, ESG compliant financial disclosures and climate risk reporting . Only 18 percent of publicly listed Nigerian companies issue sustainability reports . ICAN inducts 1,851 chartered accountants by Providence Ayanfeoluwa .

Title: Nigeria’s oil output falls to  1.486m bpd  – OPEC
Summary: Nigeria’s crude oil output, including condensate, dropped month-on-month, MoM, to 1.486 million barrels per day, bpd, in April 2025, from 1.401 million bpd in March 2025 . •As  oil price hovers at $66 per barrel •Decline heightens

Title: BREAKING: JAMB begins rescheduling of UTME for affected 379,997 S’East, Lagos candidates
Summary: The Joint Admission and Matriculation Board has begun the rescheduling of the 379,997 affected candidates . The registrar of the examination body, Prof Ishaq Oloyede, admitted errors in the just-concluded exam . He also said, “The affected candidates will start getting text messages for reschedule starting

Title: Agriculture key to Nigeria's progress - Oluremi Tinubu
Summary: Nigeria’s First Lady, Senator Oluremi Tinubu, reiterated the crucial role of agriculture in achieving food security, creating employment, and driving economic growth . This is just as she distributed farm inputs and financial grants to 400 farmers in Delta State under the Renewed Hope Initiative's Agricultural Support Programme . The distribution was held in

Title: Underfunding, brain drain impact Nigerian versities' global ranking – Registrars
Summary: The Association of Registrars of Nigerian Universities has lamented the inability of universities in the country to be among the best in the world in terms of global ranking . The association expressed this through its Chairman, Dr Bala Ahmed, who spoke at the third Registrar Workshop and 77th Business Meeting held at the Kaduna State University on

Title: FG inaugurates smart police station in Abuja
Summary: The facility is designed to improve operational efficiency and foster stronger police-community relations within the Federal Capital Territory . Additional smart police stations are expected to be commissioned in Kogi, Enugu, and other parts of the country in the coming days .

Title: LASUSTECH student gets Gani Adams’ N300,000 scholarship
Summary: Shakiru Samuel was awarded a scholarship worth N300,000 by the Gani Adams Foundation Scholarship Scheme . The award ceremony took place on Sunday, May 11, 2025, at Whitestone Event Centre, Oregun, Lagos . The student expressed appreciation to the organisers of the award scheme .
